meanings.definition: To crush or flatten something with force.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally squushed the bug when I sat on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The elephant can easily squush a watermelon with its strong trunk.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to squush the playdough into a pancake shape.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book seemed to squush the delicate flower beneath it.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's powerful grip threatened to squush his opponent into submission.

meanings.definition: A soft, wet sound made by something being squashed.
meanings.sent1: The squush of the mud under my boots signaled the start of the rainy season.
meanings.sent2: The squush of the tomato being squeezed echoed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The squush of the sponge being wrung out filled the room with water sounds.
meanings.sent4: The squush of the marshmallow being compressed was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent5: The squush of the bug being stepped on made me cringe.

meanings.definition: A squishy or squelchy feeling or texture.
meanings.sent1: The squush of the mud between my toes was unpleasant.
meanings.sent2: The squush of the jellyfish against my skin was cold and slimy.
meanings.sent3: The squush of the overripe peach in my hand was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The squush of the wet sand beneath my feet made walking difficult.
meanings.sent5: The squush of the sponge as I squeezed it released soapy water.
